content.description: Scientists are closely monitoring caribou populations to examine the effect of global climate change on habitat. The maximum population size for a herd of caribou based on the amount of habitat was <math alttext="500,000" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></math>. A herd of caribou currently has a population size of <math alttext="198,000" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mn>198</mn> <mtext>,</mtext> <mn>000</mn> </mrow> </math> caribou as a result of habitat loss.
content.question: Which of the following methods should be used to determine the percent change between the maximum population and the current population for this herd of caribou?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 500,000 caribou plus 198,000 caribou, close parenthesis, divided by 198,000 caribou, times 100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>ca</mtext><mtext>r</mtext><mtext>ibou</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>198</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>/</mo><mn>198</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 198,000 caribou minus 500,000 caribou, close parenthesis, divided by 500,000 caribou, times 100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>198</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>−</mo><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>/</mo><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="198,000 caribou, divided by 500,000 caribou, times 1,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>198</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>/</mo><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>×</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 500,000 caribou minus 198,000 caribou, close parenthesis, divided by 100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>−</mo><mn>198</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>/</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 198,000 caribou minus 500,000 caribou, close parenthesis, divided by 500,000 caribou, times 100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>198</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>−</mo><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>/</mo><mn>500</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>caribou</mtext><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 6.A: Determine an approach or method aligned with the problem to be solved.
